title: The Supreme Court’s Declaration of Independence
summary: The court’s rejection of President Trump’s tariffs program is the latest in a series of clashes between him and Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.

title: After Tariff Decision, What Happens to Trump’s Deals With China, Canada and Europe?
summary: The Supreme Court’s decision to invalidate many of President Trump’s tariffs raised questions about what would become of agreements struck with major U.S. trading partners.

title: Trump Calls Justices Who Ruled Against Him ‘Fools and Lap Dogs’
summary: “I’m ashamed of certain members of the court, absolutely ashamed for not having the courage to do what’s right for our country,” the president said.

title: Bench Presses, Pull Ups … Kid Rock? The White House Had a Very Manly Week.
summary: President Trump’s top cabinet officials are pumping iron in public.

title: C.I.A. Retracts Reports Flagged for Bias
summary: Former officials said the documents were not examples of shoddy work and simply reflected the priorities of past administrations.

title: U.S. Planes Land at Jordan Base, a Key Hub for Planning Possible Iran Strikes
summary: At least 60 attack aircraft are parked at the base, which has become a key hub for U.S. military planning for possible strikes on Iran.

title: Hungary Poses Unexpected Hurdle to Europe’s 90-Billion Euro Loan to Ukraine
summary: While the delay may prove to be procedural, Hungary signaled that it could cause problems as the European Union works to send money to Ukraine.

title: Ruben Ray Martinez Was Killed in an Undisclosed ICE Shooting in March, His Family Says
summary: A 23-year-old American was shot last March in South Padre Island. ICE’s involvement in the shooting was not disclosed until this week.

title: These Skiers Cleared Out as Group That Would Be Hit by Avalanche Arrived
summary: If the party had waited out the storm in their cabins, one of the skiers said, the outcome might have been different.

title: Was Anyone at Fault in Sierra Nevada Avalanche Deaths?
summary: Officials in Nevada County, Calif., are investigating whether there could have been criminal negligence involved in the disaster that killed at least eight people.

title: San José State University Graduate Is Found Dead in Tree Well at Lake Tahoe Resort
summary: The recent graduate, 21, was on a trail in the Lake Tahoe region of California on Tuesday and did not return, prompting a search. His death is under investigation, the authorities said.

title: Former Prince Andrew’s Arrest Upends Royal Family’s Effort to Move Past His Scandal
summary: King Charles III’s family, long rocked by infighting and grievous losses, is facing what could be the gravest threat to its moral authority in more than a generation.

title: A.I. Isn’t Coming for Every White-Collar Job. At Least Not Yet.
summary: Tech workers are increasingly worried that the artificial intelligence they are building will replace them. But some are optimistic that it is just one more tool to work with.

title: In Tibet, a Writer Finds Peace on a Trek to 18,000 Feet
summary: A writer grapples with the death of her sister, and the end of a marriage, during a challenging trek in Tibet.

title: India’s Hindu Right Seems Unstoppable. This City Shows How.
summary: Muslims make up a majority in Sambhal, but after deadly clashes over a mosque, they say they the arms of the state are now stifling them.

title: China’s ‘King of Banned Films’ Wants to Change the Subject
summary: Acclaimed overseas for defying censors, Lou Ye is more interested in reaching Chinese audiences, as he holds up a cinematic mirror to their lives in modern China.

title: Another Winter Storm Could Deliver More Snow to the Northeast This Weekend
summary: Forecasts on Friday began to make another major snowstorm look far more likely. Snow is expected to begin falling Sunday.

title: Will the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling Curb Trump?
summary: What does this mean for the president, the economy — and your bank account?

title: The Problem With Hot, White Heathcliff in ‘Wuthering Heights’
summary: It’s time to end the era of colorblind casting.

title: Trump Promises New Tariffs After Justices Rule Against Him
summary: Also, Cuba nears collapse. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: Christopher S. Wren, Times Bureau Chief in Hostile Lands, Dies at 89
summary: Over three decades, he reported from Moscow, Beijing, Tehran and elsewhere and wrote well-received books based on his reporting, including one about his globe-trotting cat.

title: Russia Takes the Gulag Out of the Gulag History Museum in Moscow
summary: The museum had preserved the history of brutality inflicted by the Soviet Union on its people. It will now focus on Nazi war crimes.

title: Dog Poop Wars: In New York, the Snow Is Foul, and So Is the Discourse
summary: As melting snow reveals weeks’ worth of uncollected dog waste, frustration at the state of the sidewalks has boiled over.

title: A Cancer Detection Test Fails in Major Study
summary: A closely watched clinical trial in Britain that screened blood for early detection of cancer did not show a reduction in diagnoses at later stages of the disease.
